SVAD: When a request signal is asserted, an acknowledgment must follow within 1 to 3 clock cycles. This property is disabled during reset (active low reset).
When valid is high, the data signal must remain stable until acknowledgment is received. This ensures data integrity during transfers.
When the FIFO count reaches maximum depth, no push operation should occur to prevent overflow.
The state machine state signal must always have exactly one bit set (one-hot encoding) during normal operation.
When request signal has a rising edge, the acknowledgment signal must have a rising edge within 0 to 5 cycles after the next clock cycle.
